intro: Discladium planchoni, commonly known as the Mediterranean sea holly, is a marine flowering plant belonging to the family Cariophyllaceae. It is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, showy flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant is typically found in shallow coastal waters, where it thrives in sandy or muddy substrates. Its reproductive strategy involves both self-pollination and cross-pollination, facilitated by water currents and visiting pollinators. Discladium planchoni plays an important ecological role in coastal ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various marine organisms.
